alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 12 at 9:23PM CST until December 15 at 12:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm Impacts the Area Midweek.. .A strong winter storm affects northern Wisconsin between Tuesday evening and Thursday. A wintry mix of freezing rain and snow arrives Tuesday night. By Wednesday morning, two to three tenths of ice may coat roadways, trees, and power lines. Travel will likely be hazardous. This ice, coupled with strong winds gusting to 35 to 45 mph, may result in localized tree damage and power outages. Snow sets in by Wednesday morning with a prolonged light to moderate snowfall through Thursday. This forecast is very sensitive to temperatures, which will be right near freezing. If temperatures warm a few degrees above freezing, icing will be reduced. Stay tuned to updates on this potentially hazardous weather. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of around two to three tenths of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...The main freezing rain threat will be Tuesday evening into early Wednesday morning, followed by snow the rest of the day and Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
